article:
## Contents
- [Introduction](#introduction)
- [Objective and Scope](#objective-and-scope)
- [Requirements and Pre-requisites](#requirements-and-pre-requisites)
- [Step-by-Step Instructions](#step-by-step-instructions)
- [Code Snippets and Commands](#code-snippets-and-commands)
- [Troubleshooting and Common Issues](#troubleshooting-and-common-issues)
- [Best Practices and Recommendations](#best-practices-and-recommendations)
- [Summary and Conclusion](#summary-and-conclusion)

## Introduction
The introduction provides a brief overview of the topic, in this case, the advanced features of GitHub Actions. It sets the context for the rest of the documentation.

## Objective and Scope
The objective and scope section defines the purpose of the documentation and outlines what it covers. It helps the reader understand what they can expect to learn from the document.

## Requirements and Pre-requisites
The requirements and pre-requisites section lists any necessary requirements or pre-requisites that the user should have before proceeding with the advanced features of GitHub Actions. This may include having a GitHub account, knowledge of basic Git commands, etc.

## Step-by-Step Instructions
The step-by-step instructions section provides detailed, easy-to-follow instructions for using the advanced features of GitHub Actions. Each step should be clearly explained and accompanied by any necessary screenshots or code snippets.

## Code Snippets and Commands
The code snippets and commands section includes relevant code snippets and terminal commands that the user can use while working with the advanced features of GitHub Actions. These snippets and commands should be well-documented and explained.

## Troubleshooting and Common Issues
The troubleshooting and common issues section provides solutions to common problems that users may encounter while working with the advanced features of GitHub Actions. It should address any error messages or issues that users may face and provide clear instructions on how to resolve them.

## Best Practices and Recommendations
The best practices and recommendations section offers tips and recommendations for using the advanced features of GitHub Actions effectively. It may include suggestions for optimizing workflows, improving security, or following industry best practices.

## Summary and Conclusion
The summary and conclusion section recaps the key points covered in the documentation and provides any final thoughts or recommendations. It should leave the reader with a clear understanding of the advanced features of GitHub Actions and how to use them effectively.
